docs.text: true faith and its expression through organized religion is a difficult subject for a motion picture to tackle head-on , which is probably why so few of them do it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even the most religious directors - like martin scorsese or ingmar bergman - usually address issues of faith in implicit rather than explicit religious terms .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: so it's not hard to see why it took robert duvall fifteen years to get " the apostle " onto the big-screen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as a matter of fact , even after fifteen years he still never managed to get financial backing , and he ended up paying for it with $5 million of his own money .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he also wrote the script , directed the film , and starred as the central character , a fiery texas preacher named euliss " sonny " dewey .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: few filmmakers have the courage and sheer audacity to take on that kind of financial , technical , and creative responsibility single-handedly , and it's testament to what an intensely personal project this was for duvall .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and , thankfully , every bit of that personal investment translates on-screen into power and honest emotion .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sonny is an energetic , pentecostal preacher who has been speaking ( actually shouting ) from behind the pulpit since he was twelve .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he spends much of his time traveling about the country , evangelizing with other preachers at tent revivals .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unlike most hollywood characterizations of intense preachers , sonny is not a phony or a swindler , and the film's purpose is not to unearth hypocrisy and sin in either sonny or the church .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: duvall makes it abundantly clear that sonny truly believes in what he says , although like all humans , he has weaknesses .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one of his weaknesses become apparent when he finds out that , not only does his long-suffering wife , jessie ( farrah fawcett ) , want to leave him for another man in the congregation , but the two of them have secretly plotted to remove him as preacher .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: faced with the loss of two things he loves passionately- his church and his family - that same raw power that allows sonny to get entire congregations rocking and swaying transforms into a violent temper .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: at his son's baseball game , sonny snaps and smashes his wife's lover in the face with a baseball bat , inflicting a wound that may be fatal .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: not knowing what else to do , sonny disappears .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he throws away his identification , drives his car into a lake , and takes a bus to louisiana , hoping to start over again .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the tiny , mostly poor coastal town of bayou boutte , sonny once again finds his calling .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after befriending a simple auto mechanic ( walt goggins ) and tracking down the town's ex-minister ( john beasley ) , sonny sets up his own church , the one way to heaven temple .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: re-christening himself as " the apostle e . f . , " he quickly draws together an eager congregation , and together they realize real change in each other's lives .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but , always , sonny's past is lurking a step behind him , waiting to swallow his progress .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: duvall has made his intentions in making " the apostle " clear .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in a recent article in " newsweek , " he wrote : " filmmakers hardly ever depict spirituality with such a strong emphasis on the holy spirit , and when they do , it tends to be patronizing - full of charlatans and snake handlers . . .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but what i really wanted to do was try to understand what these preachers go through and what they believe , and to portray it in an accurate way . "
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the strength of duvall's convictions turn out to be the strength of his film - " the apostle " always rings true , even in the most painful moments , because we know he's being sincere with the subject matter .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after fifteen years of traveling the country , listening to all shapes and sizes of ministers and taking studious notes on what they said , duvall has captured the energy and vitality of what it means to be truly spiritual .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his sonny is a man who speaks directly to god and expects to be spoken right back to .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " i've always called you jesus and you've always called me sonny , " he says .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when neighbors call and complain that he is being too loud one night in one his rants with the man upstairs , sonny's mother ( june carter cash ) just hangs up on them because she knows there's no sense trying to interrupt him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the main theme to emerge from " the apostle " is the fact that good can come from any situation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sonny's act of violence toward another human being is inarguably a horrific thing , and duvall never shrinks from that fact .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , that very same act of violence is what brings sonny to bayou boutte , where he finds people whom he desperately needs and who desperately need him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in his short time in louisiana , he does a world of good , and when the police finally show up to take him away , he goes quietly , knowing that he deserves the punishment that is awaiting him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and , as a scene during the final credits shows , he even turns his punishment into a positive opportunity for change and betterment .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is that strength in sonny's character that makes him so appealing and magnetic to others - he is flawed , but he is powerful enough to overcome those flaws .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: weak men are the ones who simply accept their weaknesses and lack the desire to better themselves .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: watching duvall on-screen , it's not hard to imagine that he would have been a magnificent preacher if he had chosen that vocation over acting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as sonny , he completely inhabits the character , and his performance is certainly the best of the year .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: because he spent so much time absorbing the traits , methods , quirks , and personalities of real preachers , duvall was able to create a complete character who always feels indelibly human .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as a director , duvall feels that less is more .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his camera simply takes in what goes on in front of it , with very little intrusion .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there are no fancy crane shots or extended dollies or excessive close-ups .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: duvall knew that the power of the film's characters ( enhanced by the fact that he cast mostly non-professional churchgoers and actual ministers ) didn't need to be artificially enhanced .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in this way , " the apostle " almost plays out like a documentary , not only in its technical simplicity , but more importantly , in its sense of reality .
docs.label: positive
